title: Frontend-only full visual redesign and layout rebalancing across key pages

requirements.text: Implement a consistent global layout system that prevents content from appearing too high under the fixed header, by introducing a uniform top offset for page content and consistent vertical rhythm (spacing) across the site, without changing navigation, content, or functionality.

quotes: Please proceed with the layout‑adjustment phase immediately... to ensure the interface is professional, visually balanced, and consistent across the entire site.

acceptanceCriteria: All routed pages render their first meaningful content below the fixed header (no overlap).
A single, consistent approach is used site-wide (e.g., a shared page wrapper / page shell) rather than ad-hoc per-page fixes.
No text content, routes, or functional behavior changes (authentication flow, wallet read-only labels, links) are introduced as part of this change.

requirements.text: Perform a full visual redesign (spacing, alignment, typography, component layout) for the critical pages: Home, Login entry points (header login button + any auth-required screens), AR page(s), Map page(s), Profile page(s), and Rules page(s), ensuring a cohesive and professional presentation while preserving existing content and interactions.

quotes: I confirm Option 2: a full visual redesign across all pages, including spacing, alignment, typography, and component layout.
prioritizing critical pages such as Home, Login, AR, Map, Profile, and Rules

acceptanceCriteria: Home page layout is visually balanced on mobile and desktop: consistent padding, aligned center content, and no elements clipped by the viewport or header.

Login entry points are visually consistent: the Header login button styling matches the new system, and auth-required screens (e.g., Wallet/Swap unauthenticated states) match the same typography/spacing rules.
If AR/Map/Profile/Rules pages exist in the codebase (including placeholder pages), they use the same redesigned page shell, typography scale, and spacing system as Home/Wallet/Swap.
No backend calls, React Query behavior, or identity logic is changed.

requirements.text: Unify typography, spacing tokens, and component composition across pages by standardizing headings, body text, max-width containers, and card/badge/button layout rules to eliminate inconsistent margins/paddings and improve readability.

quotes: full visual redesign across all pages, including spacing, alignment, typography, and component layout

acceptanceCriteria: Heading hierarchy is consistent across pages (e.g., H1/H2 sizing and font usage) and does not vary arbitrarily between Home, Wallet, Swap, Landing, Docs/Legal pages.
All primary page sections use consistent max-width and horizontal padding conventions (e.g., container usage) for mobile/tablet/desktop.
Buttons, cards, and banners (including the 'Read-Only – Transfers Disabled' banners) maintain their wording but have consistent spacing, alignment, and responsive behavior.
No Shadcn UI component source files under frontend/src/components/ui are modified (compose instead).

requirements.text: Apply a single cohesive visual theme (colors, typography, layout style) across all pages and components to make the UI feel deliberate and consistent. Keep the existing dark + gold direction but refine it into a polished, editorial 'dark-luxury' system with consistent surfaces, borders, and hover/focus states.

quotes: ensure the interface is professional, visually balanced, and consistent across the entire site

acceptanceCriteria: The site uses a consistent set of surface styles (backgrounds, glass cards, borders) and interaction states (hover/focus/disabled) across Header, Footer, and main page content.
No new product features are introduced; only visual/presentation improvements are made.
Theme changes do not reduce accessibility (text contrast remains readable on dark backgrounds).

constraints: Frontend-only changes: no canister changes, no backend modifications, no token minting, no transfers, no simulations.
Maintain all current content, navigation, and functionality (presentation changes only).

Do not edit immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and any sources under frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Adding new backend endpoints or changing Motoko state/schema.
Implementing new AR/Map/game functionality beyond visual/layout work.
Changing routing structure or adding new navigation items not already present.
Replacing existing generated images/logos (unless explicitly requested later).
